intro: Phylica pinea, commonly known as the silver pine or coastal pine, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to the coastal regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa and Namibia. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and dense, dark green foliage that turns silver-white in full sun. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in spherical inflorescences. Phylica pinea is well adapted to coastal environments, tolerating salt spray and sandy soils.
